metadata.title: CVE-2019-15679 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
TightVNC code version 1.3.10 contains heap buffer overflow inInitialiseRFBConnection function, which can potentially result codeexecution. This attack appear to be exploitable via network connectivity.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

tightvncserver - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
xtightvncviewer - 1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvncserver: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
x11vnc package in trusty is affected and may need fixing.
tightvnc package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.3.9-6.5+deb8u1build0.14.04.1~esm1').
x2vnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
ssvnc: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
vncsnapshot: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
